p: The Adyar sub-basin has one weather monitoring station, i.e., Meenambakkam station, established by the India Meteorological Department (IMD). It is the first and the oldest observatory that was established two centuries ago at Chennai in 1792. For the period 1975–2015, the daily rainfall data of the Meenambakkam station were obtained by the Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC), IMD, Chennai. For the Meenambakkam station, the seasonal and annual analyses of rainfall were performed on the basis of the observed rainfall data. According to the IMD guidelines, extremely heavy rainfall events (>244.5 mm/day) were analyzed during 1975–2015.
